projects.name: Redux Middleware for handling socket messages
projects.description: Redux is the popular state management library used with React. This project helped me explore the creation of a middleware for redux. The middleware encapsulates the socket io component by listening to particular actions and converting it to respective socket io commands (messages).

projects.name: Persistant memory using IndexedDb
projects.description: This project is a replica of one of the tools that I created in Infosys to save the state of the React-Redux app. The major problem I faced while developing an application for Insurance Agents was that it had a pretty bad developer experience when it came to unit testing. I had to fill in hundreds of fields to test one scenario. This hack solved the problem by saving the Redux state in Indexed DB and fetches it when required. It's particularly helpful for testing many use cases without filling in much of the data. Local storage is an ideal solution for smaller apps but the project that I was working in Infosys had huge JSON and local storage was only capable of storing 5 of those objects. Hence Indexed DB saved our day by capturing the state of the applications across reloads for testing purposes.

projects.name: Data Driven Food Courts
projects.description: This is a Hackathon project. Food Ordering tool which also focused on food waste management. Along with developing a mobile app to order food and a web app to receive orders. This was phase one of the app and as part of phase 2, we demonstrated the use of capturing data from order history and wastage quantity to develop an algorithm that would then predict the approximate orders for any given day and minimize wastage.
